thread.title: Morning links: Utes in the playoff?; Andre Miller a mentor in Minnesota; Ex-Cougar Guthrie reflects on Oregon shooting
thread.title_full: Morning links: Utes in the playoff?; Andre Miller a mentor in Minnesota; Ex-Cougar Guthrie reflects on Oregon shooting

title: Morning links: Utes in the playoff?; Andre Miller a mentor in Minnesota; Ex-Cougar Guthrie reflects on Oregon shooting
text:
By Ryan McDonald , Deseret News Published: Monday, Oct. 5 2015 8:55 a.m. MDT Updated: 33 minutes ago Utah wide receiver Britain Covey (18) scores a touchdown during the second half of an NCAA college football game against Oregon, Saturday, Sept. 26, 2015, in Eugene, Ore. Ryan Kang, Associated Press Summary 
National analysts continue to praise Utah; ex-Runnin' Ute point guard featured; former BYU pitcher discusses tragedy in hometown. “ I just want to be known as a guy who comes in, works hard, doesn’t take days off.” Andre Miller 
A bye week for the University of Utah football team didn't do a whole lot to quiet the national chatter surrounding the squad's 4-0 start. 
Of particular significance, two Fox football analysts and ESPN ranked the Utes No. 1 in the country after a weekend in which Kyle Whittingham's club moved up five spots in the AP poll despite not playing. 
Wrote Stewart Mandel about Utah: "A week later, I’m still in awe of the Utes’ 62-20 clinic at Oregon, and that Week 1 win over Michigan looks better every week." 
After the Wolverines moved up to No. 18 in the AP poll, Bruce Feldman echoed Mandel's sentiments about Utah's season-opening victory against Jim Harbaugh's team, writing, "Their Week 1 win over Michigan keeps looking better and better." 
ESPN wrote in its weekly power rankings , which saw the Utes move up eight spots: "If Utah is going to make a run through the Pac-12, that defense and tricky special teams will be two major reasons why." 
Ex-Ute Andre Miller ready to mentor in Minnesota 
Set to begin his 17th season in the NBA, former University of Utah point guard Andre Miller will be taking on more of a teaching role with the upstart Minnesota Timberwolves. 
With two young floor generals on the roster in Ricky Rubio and Tyus Jones, Miller is being counted on to impart his veteran wisdom, according to a feature by Jerry Zgoda of the Minneapolis Star Tribune. 
"I just want to be known as a guy who comes in, works hard, doesn’t take days off," Miller said. "I enjoy definitely meeting younger guys and helping them get better.” 
Former Cougar Guthrie discusses Oregon shooting 
Now a pitcher with Major League Baseball's Kansas City Royals, former BYU hurler Jeremy Guthrie spent his formative years in Roseburg, Oregon, the site of a shooting last week that saw 10 people get killed. 
In a story by Jay Rosen of the Associated Press, Guthrie recalled his time in the small town and voiced his thoughts on the tragedy. 
"You keep them in your prayers and just hope that at some point in time, we, as a society, and as people, can learn to cope with struggles and difficulties and challenges in our lives in a different way," he said. Ryan McDonald is a sports reporter at DeseretNews.com . Follow him on Twitter @ryanwmcdonald. Recommended Stories
